data.title: Stochastic Bug in image loading in 0.4x file loading
data.meta_description:
Hey, 
I have a project created in QuPath 0.3.2. I transferred the project folder and the image files to another computer. When I opened the project in 0.4.3,  it found the new location of the files (same relative path), …
data.text:
Hey,

I have a project created in QuPath 0.3.2. I transferred the project folder and the image files to another computer. When I opened the project in 0.4.3, it found the new location of the files (same relative path), and found the thumbnail images. But, when I open some (but not all!) of the images, I get an error message that says: "java.lang.NullPointerException: Cannot invoke "java.awt.image.BufferedImage.getWidth()" because "imgInput" is null" . Many errors appear in the log (pasted below). Other images in this project open fine, but then throw this error when I try to zoom???

I can opened the transferred images in Zen. I can still open the project in 0.3.2 on the new computer and everything works fine, so the problem is not that the files are corrupted. I can make a new project in 0.4.3 and fill it with the files and that seems to work.

Everything about the project creation and transfer I just said might actually be a red herring. @Zbigniew_Mikulski has seen the same issue in brand new projects, but only on certain Win10 computers, and still only some of the time. The only consistent factor that we’ve seen is that it’s with .czi files, but that’s 90% of what we work with, so it might just be chance. Sorry, I know stochastic bugs are the worst to figure out.

This person seems to have the exact same problem and it never really got solved.

Here is some the error log. The forum won’t let me paste the entire thing because it’s longer than the maximum characters for a post:

15:51:03.716 [JavaFX Application Thread] [INFO ] qupath.lib.gui.QuPathGUI - Project set to Project: Kidney OOF_Fold-project 15:51:06.096 [JavaFX Application Thread] [ERROR] q.l.i.s.b.BioFormatsImageServer$ReaderPool - Error opening image 0 for BioFormatsImageServer: file:///D:/Fixation%20HE/Kidney/sara+czi@lji.org_SM1_01_HE_2022-04-21-Scene-2-ScanRegion1.czi[--series,
